revised_title: Thermodynamics of Intracrystalline Sorption: Energetics of Occlusion of Argon and Nitrogen by Faujasite-Type Crystals
tldr: The authors investigated the energetics of occlusion of argon and nitrogen in various ion-exchanged faujasite-type crystals. They found that the affinity and heat of intercalation for nitrogen were considerably higher than for argon. The crystals behaved as energetically homogeneous sorbents for certain cationic forms. The study provides insights into the role of dispersion, repulsion, polarization, and quadrupole interactions in the sorption process.
